intro: Phyllanthus patens, commonly known as the slender leaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Phyllanthus patens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
